lead_paragraph: Marco Cecchinato, the youngest Italian man in the ATP top 250, was barred for eighteen months by his national federation after he was accused of fixing two matches.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.

headline.print_headline: Three Players Barred for Match Fixing Amid Criticism of Sport’s Integrity Unit
headline.main: Italian Match Fixing Suspensions Imposed Amid Criticism of Tennis Watchdog

snippet: Marco Cecchinato, the youngest Italian man in the ATP top 250, was barred for eighteen months by his national federation after he was accused of fixing two matches....
abstract: Italian Tennis Federation bars Marco Cecchinato for 18 months and fines him over $40,000 after he is accused of fixing two of his matches and using confidential information for gambling; players Riccardo Accardi and Antonio Campo are also barred and fined for involvement in case.
